CatDescriptText: Mary Owens, housewife, Hill District and Harry H. Brown, owner of Sputnik Shoe Shine Shop, 2119 Wylie Avenue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 6, 1960, pg. A1, with question: "In what areas of endeavor or public accommodations do you find the most discrimination?"  Mrs. Owens' answer reads: "Well, from what i have experienced, eating places, particularly McCrory's downtown."  Mr. Brown's answer reads: "I think housing, and particularly in the Squirrel Hill area.  In the suburbs, they are very discriminatory in housing, schools, and in employment, too."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mary Owens wearing floral dress and eyeglasses, standing in front of brick wall; Portrait of Harry H. Brown wearing light colored t-shirt, standing in front of window with painted sign, possibly Sputnik Shoe Shine Shop, 2119 Wylie Avenue
